content:
/>
V.iii.5.2.b
.
Impact of NSC Conditions on the Evaluation of METs
Non-service-connected (NSC) disabilities, such as a chronic respiratory condition or morbid obesity, may have an impact on METs results.
When an examiner cannot determine METs attributable to an SC cardiovascular disability due to the effects of NSC conditions and provides a sufficient rationale detailing why the determination cannot be provided, follow the guidance in
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 3.D.2.c
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 5 - Cardiovascular System Conditions
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 5, Section None
